p: Among different climatic factors, average minimum monthly temperature (Â°C) ( r = 0. 672, P<0. 05, df = 10; Fig 3a) and average monthly rainfall (mm) ( r = 0. 820, P<0. 01, df = 10; Fig 3b) are significantly correlated with occurrence of A. fulica in India ( Table 6). Most records of A. fulica were from altitudes ranging from 1-100m asl (62.45%; Fig 4). There were few records from above 1000m asl.
